basic.description: In recent years, and especially in the wake of the 2008 global recession, the legal profession has changed radically in Canada and around the world. Competition for jobs and legal work has intensified and traditional forms of lawyering are in transition. This course analyzes the forces behind these changes, discusses new lawyering structures, and focuses on identifying the ¿business¿ skills that law graduates need to succeed in the ¿new normal¿, whether contemplating a career in practice or elsewhere. Topics include:  (a)recent changes in lawyering roles and the impact of globalization; (b) developing a practice/career strategy and (c) obtaining the necessary skills and knowledge: business development, client relations, financial management, leadership, technology.  A panel of experienced guest instructors introduces the topics in a format that encourages class participation.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Succeeding as a Lawyer:  Mastering the Business of Law
